questions.question: 3. In a single-phase inverter, which harmonic component is not present

explanations.a: Explanation 1: Single-phase inverter operating in square-wave mode, the output voltage waveform is symmetrical (odd symmetry), hence only odd harmonics (1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, etc.), and no even harmonics (2nd, 4th, 6th, etc.).
